issues.description: The UML diagram in the problem statement declares numberOfInscribedStudents and numberOfGuestStudents as type double, but the reference solution (and expected constructor parameters, getters/setters, and methods) defines these attributes as int. Students following the UML will implement double fields and then encounter mismatches when writing the constructor, getters/setters, and total‐students methods.
issues.suggested_fix: Revise the UML diagram in the problem statement to declare numberOfInscribedStudents and numberOfGuestStudents as int (instead of double) so it aligns with the solution and avoids type conflicts.
